author: Zahra Mulroy
title: Rochelle Humes asks for advice on 'mysterious' line down tummy - fans provide answer
text:
Get daily   Could   
To say childbirth is a pretty big deal would be an understatement. 
It's a momentous physiological feat and, as such, there's plenty of 'behind the scenes' work which goes on during the nine months leading up to it. 
Some of the necessary physical and hormonal changes are more widely known than others, and seeing as a mum's experience of pregnancy can be different each time, there are plenty of weird and wonderful quirks to catch us off-guard. 
Already mum to three-year-old Alaia-Mai, The Saturday's star Rochelle Humes , 27, is expecting her second child with former JLS star Marvin Humes. 
Having recently noticed a dark line running down her tummy, she took to Instagram to ask her fans for advice, meaning it's unlikely she had it when pregnant with Alaia-Mai. 
Rochelle captioned the image: "Okay what is this line down my tummy and does it have a purpose?! Or is it a pointless little trail?" What is linea nigra? 
The technical term for the line is linea negra, and interestingly, it's always been there, marking where the connective tissue of your abdominal muscles meet, albeit as a line alba (white line). 
It simply appears darker around week 23 of a pregnancy. Rochelle Humes and Marvin Humes (Photo: Rex Features) 
It's thought the darkening is principally caused by an increased production of estrogen leading to extra melanin being produced. 
A popular old wives tale suggests that if it runs only up to the belly button, you're carrying a girl, but if goes past the belly button, then it's a boy. Read More Pre-babies performing with The Saturdays (Photo: WireImage) Mums responded in their hundreds to the photo. 
Many of them revealed how they thought it was linked to the baby's sex. 
"I had this with my son but not my daughter," commented Jen Boardman. Read More
